paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted information on the TTR gene variant p.D58Y, including clinical significance, patient demographics, penetrance data, and individual records.

individual_records.phenotype_details: transthyretin amyloid cardiomyopathy with symptoms including syncope and reduced ejection fraction
individual_records.evidence_sentence: A previously healthy 55-year-old man underwent a physical examination where a reduction in ejection fraction (EF) was found accidentally.

functional_data.summary: The mutation is associated with transthyretin amyloid cardiomyopathy.

variants.segregation_data: No family history of amyloidosis was reported.
variants.additional_notes: This is the first detailed clinical phenotype report for the p.D58Y mutation.
key_quotes: Here, we report a rare transthyretin mutation p.D58Y in a Chinese patient and provide detailed CA information for the first time.

extraction_metadata.notes: The extraction was straightforward as the paper provided clear information on the TTR variant.
